attributes.action: allow audio recordings in the Scottish Court's UNDER THE ACT OF UNION 1707
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I am a person who was born in Scotland who resides in the united kingdom and require my rights under the 1707 Act of union which gave me the same rights across the board as the people in the uk,I am a citizen of these United Kingdoms and would expect the same rights as a member of the European Union that which superceeds U.K.law I am dyslexic and require audio recordings for my warranty and ultimately the court's, I have applied by motion to have my case recorded in the Public Interest and have been refused,my last motion was at the Court of Session in Edinburgh on the 16 Nov 2007, I explained that I was protected under the disability discrimination Act 1995,I was again refused by lord Nimmo Smith, Lord Phylp, Lord Wheatley

rejection.details: This is a devolved matter and should be directed to the Scottish Executive as appropriate.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
